alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 28 at 4:40AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG AND GUSTY SOUTHEAST WINDS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... Gusty southeast winds will affect a large portion of Southcentral today, from the Kenai Peninsula to Anchorage, the Matanuska Valley, and the southern to western Susitna Valley. Winds will gradually increase this morning, then peak this afternoon and evening. Winds will then diminish overnight tonight through Wednesday morning. Here is the forecast peak wind gusts for select areas: Southern Kenai Peninsula: 30 to 50 mph, highest along the south side of Kachemak Bay Interior Kenai Peninsula: 20 to 35 mph Turnagain Arm: 25 to 45 mph Anchorage Upper Hillside: 55 to 70 mph Anchorage near the mountains, including Eagle River and the Glenn Highway between Anchorage and Eagle River: 30 to 45 mph Anchorage Bowl: 25 to 35 mph Matanuska Valley: 30 to 45 mph, strongest along the Knik River Valley The wind could cause hazardous conditions when walking or driving on ice covered surfaces, so use caution when getting out and about today. For the latest forecast for your area visit www.weather.gov/anchorage.

area.areaDesc: Anchorage; Matanuska Valley; Susitna Valley; Western Kenai Peninsula
